actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend section 228 of the Social Security Act to provide that an uninsured individual who is permanently and totally disabled (and has attained age 72) may become entitled to monthly benefits thereunder at any time, without regard to coverage and without any reduction for governmental pensions.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Provides that an uninsured individual who is permanently and totally disabled (and has attained aged 72) may become entitled to monthly benefits under title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act at any time, without regard to coverage and without any reduction for governmental pensions.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 228 of the Social Security Act to provide that an uninsured individual who is permanently and totally disabled (and has attained age 72) may become entitled to monthly benefits thereunder at any time, without regard to coverage and without any reduction for governmental pensions.
